text: In an era dominated by AI systems, there is a growing concern about the potential biases in AI applications that could disproportionately affect marginalized groups. To address this issue, we conducted a laboratory study using Virtual Reality (VR) to investigate empathy levels in interactions with a biased AI system. Participants assumed different personas with varying financial credit scores based on age and gender. Our results revealed that participants who embodied personas in VR exhibited heightened empathy towards the characters and perceived the AI as less fair compared to a control scenario where they imagined being these characters. We also explored differences in embodied personas and discussed qualitative insights to illuminate participants' mental models.
